intro: Ampliglossum montanum, commonly known as the mountain ampie, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soils. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
